messages.body: $AAPL Apple Inc: Are Investors Focusing Too Much on iPhone Unit Trends? Top Analyst Says Watch Out for Services Steam https://www.smarteranalyst.com/2018/03/21/apple-inc-aapl-investors-focusing-much-iphone-unit-trends-top-analyst-says-watch-services-steam

links.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL): Are Investors Focusing Too Much on iPhone Unit Trends? Top Analyst Says Watch Out for Services Steam - Smarter Analyst
links.description: Top analyst Amit Daryanani at RBC Capital is out taking a closer look into Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:) and its Services segment, believing investors have been "hyperfocused" on the wrong part of a much bigger picture: iPhone unit trends. For Daryanani, it's all about the tech giant's talent in being able to boost margins, scale back "cyclicality," and step up attractive valuation.

messages.body: $AAPL https://www.theverge.com/2018/3/19/17138258/apple-airpods-audiophile-review-wireless-headphones

links.title: Apple AirPods: the audiophile review
links.description: As The Verge's resident headphones obsessive, I'm not supposed to like the AirPods. My initial reaction upon first seeing them many months ago was to pour scorn on Apple's designers for crafting a pair of expensive and easy-to-lose cigarette butts. The AirPods were the resurrection of the awful Bluetooth headsets of years past, I thought.

links.title: Designed in California, made in China: how the iPhone skews U.S. trade deficit
links.description: U.S. President Donald Trump often tweets from his iPhone about pressuring China to address its $375 billion (266.81 billion pounds) trade surplus with the United States. The big trade imbalance - at the heart of a potential trade war, with Trump expected to impose tariffs on Chinese imports this week

links.description: U.S. stock futures were lower on Wednesday, March 21, as Wall Street prepped for the first interest rate decision from Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell. Contracts tied to the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 32 points, while those linked to the S&P 500 fell 3.50 points.

$AAPL Tech stocks are in the midst of a rough patch, but one analyst is pointing to a beacon of light. https://stocknews.com/news/aapl-apple-inc-aapl-may-be-better-buy-than-fang-stocks/

links.title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) May Be Better Buy Than FANG Stocks
links.description: It has been a challenging week for tech stocks, but Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares remain a strong possibility for investors to consider. That's the take from Strategas Research Partners head of technical analysis Chris Varrone, who points to Apple as a must-own in comparison to FANG stocks.
